::: {class="maintext1"}
[**Courses I've Taught:**]{style="font-size:35px"}

I've had the honor of serving as a Teaching Associate for six quarters across four different classes. Teaching Associate is a title given to graduate students who are serving as the sole and primary instructor for a given course. Duties as a Teaching Associate include: creation of course content (lectures, homework assignments, lab handouts, etc.), managing TAs, and issuing final letter grades. 

As a proponent of open-source teaching, most of my material from when I teach courses remains publicly accessible through a series of GitHub pages (linked below). 

If you would like to adopt any of my material for your course, please contact me first. In general, I am happy to share my source material with you - I mainly only ask for attribution. Thank you!

::: {class="maintext1"}
[**Courses I've TA'd:**]{style="font-size:35px"}

I've also had the privilege of serving as both a Teaching Assistant (TA) as well as a Head TA across several courses. As a Head TA, duties include: assisting the instructor in course creation, managing course TAs and ULAs (Undergraduate Learning Assistants), and also teaching one Discussion/Lab Section.

::: {class="maintext1"}
[**Lead TA**]{style="font-size:35px"}

Since Fall 2023, I have also served as the **Lead TA** for the PSTAT department, a role I am honored to continue serving during the 2025-2026 academic year. As part of this role, I run **PSTAT 501**, our department's designated Teaching Assistant Training course, in Fall and Winter quarter. Over the course of this two-quarter class, new graduate students learn the basics of statistical pedagogy, are connected with on-campus resources, and given tools to succeed as thriving Teaching Assistants for the PSTAT department.
:::
